Html:
Hi,

    I tried to run the Project linker tool from the experimental hive as instructed in http://microsoft.com/compositewpf
   When I tried to open a silverlight project in the experimental hive it was not able to open it (only silverlight applications). But im already doing silverlight development with the normal Visual studio dev environment and there is no problem.
   Am I missing something here? Should I do something to enable silverlight projects when I use the Visual Studio Experimental hive?

Thanks,
Ranjith

Hi Ranjith

 

A probable reason for this to happen, is that the original Visual Studio hive from the registry is cloned to create the experimental hive when Visual Studio SDK is installed. However, if you perform modifications to the original Visual Studio (like installing Silverlight), these changes will not be mapped to the experimental hive.

 

You can reset the experimental hive to the same state as the regular hive using the VsRegEx utility.

 

Perhaps you could find the following articles useful:

·         VsRegEx Command-Line Utility

·         Experimental Build

 

Please let me know if this helps.

 

Damian Schenkelman

http://blogs.southworks.net/dschenkelman

Hi Damian,

    The VsRegEx command helped me clone the original hive and I was able to view Silverlight projects too in the experimental hive.

Thanks,
Ranjith
